Sentence.sentence: Funding agencies note that data paid for with public money should be public information, and the scientific community is recognizing that data can now be shared digitally in ways that were not possible before.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The state recognizes this in the large body of family laws that govern children' welfare, yet parents receive little help in meeting the life-changing obligations society imposes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At the same time, we recognize that children might have an interest in entering adulthood free to create their own digital footprint.
Sentence.come: 2018年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Creating this sanctuary is a bold move that the people of Palau recognize as essential to our survival.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: give the right computer a massive database of faces, and it can process what it sees—then recognize a face it's told to find—with remarkable speed and precision.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: In fact, lower-tier school alumni networks are arguably stronger, because fellow alumni recognize that you didn't necessarily have an easy path to follow.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Once we recognize that these things happen to us, we are half way to doing something about them.
Sentence.come: 2019年6月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"承认"之意。
means: acknowledge ：通常指公开承认某事的真实情况或自己的过错。
admit ：强调因外力或良心驱使或经判断而明确承认，多含不情愿或被迫意味。
confess ：语气较强，着重承认自己意识到的错误或罪行，含坦白忏悔的意味。
recognize ：作"承认"解时，系书面用词，主要指合法的或外交上的承认，也指公认。
concede ：指在事实与证据面前勉强或不得不承认。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"认出，识别"之意。
means: identify ： 指辨别、确定人的身份或物品的归属等。
recognize ： 指所辨认的人或物多是以前所熟悉的。
make out ： 通常指通过人的感觉器官来辨别事物。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可辨识的, 可以审理的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cogn知道+ize……化+able可以……的→cognizable可辨识的
cogn知道+ize……化+ant表形容词→cognizant认知的
pre预先+cogn知道+ition表名词→预先知道→预知
re再+cogn知道+ize表动词→再次知道→认出来

Sentence.sentence: Bach died in 1750, but it was not until the early 19th century that his musical gift was fully recognized.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: China's image is improving steadily, with more countries recognizing its role in international affairs.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Data collected from the device could be used to recognize different participants based on how they typed, with very low error rates.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: English is a dynamic language that admits new words and recognizes changes in meaning, spelling, and usage of familiar words.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 任务型读写 原文

Sentence.sentence: For example, she received the 2007 Brick Award recognizing the efforts of young people to change the world.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It is easy to recognize a person's class.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读D 选项

Sentence.sentence: Items like T-shirts that allow volunteers to be recognized publicly for their contributions can help strengthen role identity.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: James Brindley is recognized as one of the leading early canal engineers.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: No sooner did she leave my doorstep than I had emails from two women whose kids go to my son's nursery and who recognized my face.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Nurses should recognize their own personal and cultural construction of silence so that a patient's silence is not interrupted too early or allowed to go on unnecessarily.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Of the nineteen recognized polar bear subpopulations, three are declining, six are stable, one is increasing, and nine lack enough data.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷I 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The salesgirl looked at him for a second, then recognized him and said, "Oh, hi!".
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: They recognize there's something missing in their lives, but it's hard to step off the track.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: We recognized that kurt wasn't just trying to make a sale.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: When a dark-colored cake was served on a black plate rather than a white one, customers recognized it as sweeter and more tasty.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: In Europe, where forestry is ecologically more advanced, the noncommercial tree species are recognized as members of the native forest community, to be preserved as such, within reason.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研翻译原文

Sentence.sentence: To get the system working again, losses must be recognized and dealt with.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: These gave banks more freedom to use models to value illiquid assets and more flexibility in recognizing losses on long-term assets in their income statement.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Failing to recognize that, he notes, leads to "an overly simplified view of what the solutions might be".
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Failing to recognize that, he notes, leads to an overly simplified view of what the solutions might be.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Humility requires you to recognize weakness in your own arguments and sometimes also to accept reasons on the opposite side.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Knowing the results of Epley's study, it makes sense that many people hate photographs of themselves viscerally—on one level, they don't even recognize the person in the picture as themselves.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Now we can understand each other's positions and recognize our shared values, since we both care about needy workers.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: To start, we can recognize the new birds of passage, those living and thriving in the gray areas.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

means.word_mean: 认出, 识别出某人[某事物]

sentences.en: I recognized Mary by her red hat.
sentences.cn: 我凭玛丽的红帽子认出了她。

means.word_mean: 承认…有效[属实]; 认可

sentences.en: We don't recognized him to be the lawful heir.
sentences.cn: 我们不承认他为合法继承人。

means.word_mean: 承认[认清](某事物); 认识到

sentences.en: He recognized that he was not qualified for a teacher.
sentences.cn: 他认识到自己没有资格担任教师。

sentences.en: He has not recognized the seriousness of the present situation.
sentences.cn: 他还没有意识到目前形势的严重。

sentences.en: The company recognized Mr Brown's outstanding work by promoting him to chief accountant.
sentences.cn: 公司提升布朗先生为总会计师以表彰他出色的工作。

sentences.en: He recognized us with a wave.
sentences.cn: 他挥手向我们致意。

means.word_mean: [美国英语]准许(某人在会上)发言

sentences.en: If you want to speak in the meeting you should stand up and wait till the chairman recognizes you.
sentences.cn: 如果你想在会上发言，必须站起来等到主席准许才能发言。

entry.def: If you recognize someone or something, you know who that person is or what that thing is.

example.ex: The receptionist recognized him at once...
example.tran: 接待员一眼就认出他了。

example.ex: He did not think she could recognize his car in the snow...
example.tran: 他觉得她在雪天里认不出他的车子。

entry.def: If someone says that they recognize something, they acknowledge that it exists or that it is true.

example.ex: Well, of course I recognize that evil exists.
example.tran: 嗯，我当然承认邪恶的存在。

entry.def: If people or organizations recognize something as valid, they officially accept it or approve of it.
entry.tran: 正式认可;承认;正式接受;赞成

example.ex: Most doctors appear to recognize homeopathy as a legitimate form of medicine...
example.tran: 大多数医生似乎都接受顺势疗法是一种合理的医疗手段。

example.ex: France is on the point of recognizing the independence of the Baltic States.
example.tran: 法国即将承认波罗的海诸国的独立。

entry.def: When people recognize the work that someone has done, they show their appreciation of it, often by giving that person an award of some kind.
entry.tran: 赞赏，认可（某人的所作所为）

example.ex: The RAF recognized him as an outstandingly able engineer...
example.tran: 英国皇家空军表彰他是一名非常能干的机械师。

example.ex: He had the insight to recognize their talents...
example.tran: 他很有眼力，慧眼识英才。

means.word_mean: 1. accept (someone) to be what is claimed or accept his power and authority;

sentences.sentence: "The Crown Prince was acknowledged as the true heir to the throne"

means.word_mean: 2. be fully aware or cognizant of

sentences.sentence: "The fleeing convicts were picked out of the darkness by the watchful prison guards"
"I can't make out the faces in this photograph"
"The Regents officially recognized the new educational institution"

means.word_mean: 7. express obligation, thanks, or gratitude for;

sentences.sentence: "We must acknowledge the kindness she showed towards us"

means.word_mean: 8. exhibit recognition for (an antigen or a substrate)

sentences.sentence: "My work is not recognized by anybody!"
"The best student was recognized by the Dean"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (earliest attested as a term in Scots law): from Old French reconniss-, stem of reconnaistre, from Latin recognoscere 'know again, recall to mind', from re- 'again' + cognoscere 'learn'

sentences.en: The hell of it was that nobody recognized him.

sentences.en: And having been brought safely through , we recognized then that the island was called Malta.

sentences.en: She was walking when I met her, but she didn't recognize me.

sentences.en: Despite his unlikeness to the portrait which the newspaper have been printed, I recognize him immediately.

sentences.en: This is the only species of flamingo in the region, easily recognized by its pink plumage.
